cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 525 miles SE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, then turning north‐northeast across AR/TN and into the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Upper Texas / Southwest Louisiana coast near Lake Charles–Port Arthur

weather_observation.watch_coast: Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS (storm-surge watch); east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City LA (hurricane watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA (hurricane warning); Sargent TX to San Luis Pass and east of Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River (tropical-storm warning); San Luis Pass TX to Mouth of the Mississippi River (storm-surge warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast, southwest and south-central Louisiana coast, extending inland across the lower Mississippi Valley
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed for Illinois (nearest locations in table are along East Coast)
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional gusty breezes (< 25 kt) possible late week as remnants pass south/east of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (inland river port, no coastal surge exposure)
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant tropical moisture could bring 1–2 in of rain Fri–Sat; widespread 4-inch totals are not expected in north-central Illinois
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river-level rises possible downstream on the Illinois and Mississippi Rivers, but no significant port disruption anticipated
